intro: Monotagma papillosum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in bright, indirect light. Its flowers are usually pink, purple, or white, and it is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. The species is also known for its ability to bloom continuously under proper care.
